title: convenient_censoring
body:
Obstructing the view of genitals (or some other sensitive anatomical features) using several devices within a scene, such as unnecessary smoke or views with obstacles immediately in front of the viewer. Note that this tag mostly applies to obstructions that happen to be there against all odds, not cases where characters are deliberately covering themselves with something other than clothes.

[i]Example:[/i] Hair or wings that are draped over a girl's nipples don't necessarily count as convenient censoring, but if she is jumping/rolling/moving, and they just so happen to move in the way of her nipples in the process, that [i]is[/i] convenient censoring.

For artificial obstructions that are [i]external[/i] to the scene, like a [[bar_censor|black bar]] or a [[mosaic_censoring|mosaic]] pattern, use the [[censored]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[convenient leg]]
* [[convenient uncensoring]]
* [[hair censor]]
* [[hair over breasts]]
* [[interface censor]]
* [[soap censor]]
* [[steam censor]]
* [[tail censor]]
* [[wing censor]]

title: copium_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] involving a fictional inhalable substance that allowed the user to "cope" with harsh reality, usually via an [[oxygen mask]].

The word "copium" is a portmanteau of "cope" (to create a psychological defense of a lighter belief to deal with a harsh truth) and [[opium]] (a [[drugs]]).

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/copium]

title: era_bricks_(meme)
body:
In early 2023, [[meme]]s were made about the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] army putting explosive [[reactive armor]] (ERA) on seemingly everything, following deliveries of [[Leopard 2]] tanks from [[Poland]] as a part of NATO aid for the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]].

The memes spread to [[4chan]]'s /pol/, /k/ and [[Reddit]]'s r/NonCredibleDefense sub where ERA bricks were used as an exploitable, being edited onto image macros and meme templates along with Ukrainian soldier-coded Flork of Cows characters.

These ERA memes were also called "Cope Bricks" in reference to [[Copium (meme)|]] and [[Cope Cage]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Explosive Reactive Armor (ERA)":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/explosive-reactive-armor-era]

title: nudist
body:
The practice of [[nude|wearing little to no clothing]] to be "closer to [[nature]]," treating nudity as natural and nothing to be ashamed of.

This tag overlaps with (but not necessarily relates to) [[exhibitionism]] and [[zenra]], as nudists can be naked [[indoors]] (such as the privacy of their home), as opposed to the aforementioned fetishes that emphasize [[public nudity]] and exposure to others. Nudism is usually treated as a matter of personal preference rather than deliberate titillation.

Do not apply this tag simply because the character is naked. Other evidences in the image such as the character performing various mundane task naked, treat their nakedness as an ordinary matter, or is not involved in a sexual situation is required to identify this tag.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "nudist" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "[[exhibitionism]]" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.


h4. See also

* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[nude beach]]
* [[zenra]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Naturism":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naturism

title: ironclad
body:
A type of [[warship]] prevalent in the latter half of the 19th century. Characterized by their iron, usually sloped armor (although later ones have steel armor, or some composite of the two) and use of coal powered steam power (although many earlier ones also kept sails for back up or fuel saving reasons).

They were later superseded by pre-dreadnought [[battleship]].

title: naval_dress_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] designed for non-combat, parade and ceremonial use. Just like the [[military dress uniform]] of other branches, they usually have more distinctive designs, that show various [[insignia]]s and other decorations like [[medal]]s or [[ribbon bar]]s. As well, naval dress uniforms tend to be clearer in showing [[military rank insignia|rank or rate]] than those of land or air forces, with officer ranks displayed as bands on the cuffs and/or shoulder boards, and enlisted rates displayed on the upper arms. 

h4. Examples

* !post #4732949: Officer's dress whites.
* !post #3808860: Officer's dress blues. Note the [[military rank insignia]] on the cuffs.
* !post #8222231: Enlisted dress blues. 

h4. See also

* [[Naval working uniform]]
* [[Military dress uniform]]

title: naval_uniform
body:
A [[military uniform]] worn by members of a navy. Typically these will be either white or khaki in summer or tropical regions, and black or very dark blue in winter or cold regions. A [[naval dress uniform]], meant for ceremonial purposes, would usually be worn for special occasions while ashore, but rarely worn on an active vessel. Conversely, a [[naval working uniform]] is the typical clothing worn while out at sea, and is usually meant more for protection than for good looks. 

h4. Examples 

* !post #6226073: [[Naval working uniform]]s
* !post #3808860: [[Naval dress uniform]]
* !post #2382164

h4. See also

* [[List of Armed Forces]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: naval_working_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] that is worn by during day to day work on a ship. At-sea uniforms are intended more for protection than for good looks: long [[pants]] and long sleeve [[shirt]]s protect against sunburn and fire. The traditional [[sailor collar]] was another method to protect the neck and shoulder area, though more modern uniforms are made of fire-resistant materials to assist as well. Officer's uniforms are also distinctly different from those of the enlisted, usually wearing blue or khaki clothes, depending on the time period and nationality. As with [[naval dress uniform]], at-sea uniforms of both officers and enlisted qualify for this tag. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8307272
* !post #2191029

h4. See also

* [[Naval dress uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Navy Working Uniform":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Navy_Working_Uniform

title: dragon_ball_(object)
body:
The namesake objects of the [i][[Dragon Ball]][/i] series are seven magical [[orb]]s that have a number of red stars corresponding to their order in the sequence (from 1 to 7).

When all seven Dragon Balls are collected and gathered together, they allow the user to summon [[Shenron (dragon_ball)|a powerful dragon]] who will grant a number of wishes (originally one, later three). Once the wish is granted, it cannot be granted again, and the balls fly off to the ends of the earth and become nothing but inert stone until a year has passed, at which point they become Dragon Balls again.

Earth's dragon balls were created by an alien from planet [[Namek]] named [[Kami-sama (dragon ball)|Kami]].

title: shiratori_aira_(dandadan)
body: Shiratori Aira is a supporting character of the manga series [[Dandadan]]. She is a student who was formerly popular at the same school as [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]. After finding one of [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]'s kintama, Aira comes under the pretense that she is the "chosen one" that is meant to protect the world from evil and sees [[Ayase Momo]] as being her enemy. However, she unadmittedly serves as one of her main allies whenever the two are faced with the paranormal.

title: capitano_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. Also known by his codename "The Captain", he is the first of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers.

He is a survivor of the Khaenri'ah Calamity, originally known as Thrain, and cursed with immortality by [[Ronova (genshin impact)|]], the Shade of Death.

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

body:
An Emanator of Remembrance aboard the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]].

She is portrayed [[faceless female|faceless]] (covered by a crystal), and wears a [[white hoodie|white]] [[hooded dress]] over a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]]. In-game, they give access to the Forgotten Hall and Memory of Chaos game modes. 

Note that the appearance applies to persons associated with the Garden of Recollection: the Messenger should not be confused with Memosnatchers (post #8822199) if she is depicted in the Astral Express.

title: player_character_(splatoon)
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. The player can choose between an [[Inkling Girl]] and [[Inkling Boy]]. Players who acquired the Octo Expansion in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]] are also given the option to select  [[Octoling Girl]] and [[Octoling Boy]] as well. With [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] making all four options available by default.

This tag is for both the Inklings and Octoling that serve as the player's character, and for swim form Inklings and Octolings (post #2028621). Essentially acting as a fusion for both the [[inkling_player_character]] and [[octoling_player_character]] tags. Just like with those two, do not use it for named non-player characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marina_(splatoon)|]].

[b]See [[Inkling]] and [[Octoling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Inklings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Inklings and [[Octoling]]s.[/b]

title: zaku_marine_type
body:
Fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-06M Zaku Marine Type[/b]

An experimental submarine combat variant of the MS-06F [[Zaku II]], it was first featured in the original design series [[Gundam MSV]].

After [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year One]] the surviving units were repurposed and refined to be used by the [[Earth Federation]]. Dark Blue colored units were deployed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] as the [b]Marine [[Hizack]][/b].

h4.See also
* [[Zaku Mariner]]

title: aviator_cap
body:
A [[hat]] made of leather or similar material, worn by aviation [[pilot]]s and motorsport drivers to keep their head warm and to provide it some protection. Often made with ear flaps and worn with [[aviator goggles]]. Superseded by [[pilot helmet]]s when [[cockpit]]s became enclosed.

h4. See also

* [[aviator goggles]]
* [[ushanka]]

title: pilot_helmet
body:
A modern [[helmet]] worn by [[pilot]]s or military aircrew. It largely replaced the leather [[aviator cap]]s used by early pilots. Flight helmets provide impact protection. They often feature a visor, [[headset]] or [[microphone]] for both communication and noise attenuation, mounting system for [[night vision device]] and [[head-mounted display]], as well as compatibility with [[oxygen mask]]s.

h4. See also

* [[aviator goggles]]
* [[space helmet]]
* [[assault visor]]
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flight helmet":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_helmet

title: konjiki_no_yami
body:
Konjiki no Yami (金色の闇, lit. Golden Darkness), is a major character from [[To LOVE-Ru]] and [[To LOVE-Ru Darkness]]. She is portrayed as the deadliest assassin in the galaxy who is hired to kill protagonist [[Yuuki Rito]], but instead ends up falling in love with him. 

Her character design, including shapeshifting abilities and weaponized body, is based on [[Eve (Black Cat)|]] of the [[Black Cat (series)|]] manga, which was written and drawn by the artist of [i]To LOVE-Ru[/i], [[Yabuki Kentarou]].

title: akms
body:
The variant of [[AKM]] [[assault rifle]] with an [[MP40]]-styled under[[folding stock]]. The letter S on "AKMS" stands for складной ([i]Skladnoy[/i]), Russian word for "folding". This tag does not mean the plural form of AKM. 

Not to be confused with the [[AKS-74]], which has triangular side-folding stock.

h4. See also

* [[AKMSU]]
* [[Kalashnikov rifle]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: akm
body:
The [b]AKM[/b] (Russian: Автома́т Кала́шникова модернизи́рованный "[[kalashnikov rifle|Kalashnikov]]'s Automatic [[Rifle]] Modernized") is a [[Soviet]] 7.62×39mm [[assault rifle]], designed in 1950s as the major improvement from the earlier [[AK-47]]. Main features of the AKM are its stamped receiver (visible rivets) instead of heavier milled one, slanted muzzle brake, and straighter fixed buttstock profile.

Its design was copied and manufactured by various Soviet satellite states, such as Hungarian [[AMD-65]] and East German [[MPi-KM]].   

h4. Examples

* !post #7746396: AKM
* !post #5829268: [[AK-47]]. Lack of rivets and wide rectangular indentation. 
* !post #6264963: [[Type 56 assault rifle|Type 56]]. Milled or stamped receiver, but with folding spike bayonet and removable muzzle nut.

h4. See also

* [[AKMS]]
* [[RPK]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: hippogriff
body:
The hippogriff or hippogryph is a legendary creature with the front half of an [[eagle]] and the hind half of a [[horse]].

It was invented at the beginning of the 16th century by Ludovico Ariosto in his Orlando Furioso. Within the poem, the hippogriff is a steed born of a mare and a griffin—something considered impossible. It is extremely fast and is presented as being able to fly around the world and to the Moon. It is ridden by magicians and the wandering knight Ruggiero, who, from the creature's back, frees the beautiful Angelica. Astolfo also borrows the hippogriff from Bradamante to go search for Roland's wits.

The hippogriff became a subject of visual art in the 19th century, when it was often drawn by Gustave Doré. 

For it's use in the Fate series, see [[Hippogriff_(Fate)|]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hippogriff":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hippogriff

title: ryuujou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Ryuujou[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. Her default outfit consists of a maroon/dark red [[kariginu]]-like vest over a [[white shirt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], a [[magatama]] necklace, [[visor cap]] patterned off her real-life bow, [[thigh strap]]s holding [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, [[white socks]], and [[platform footwear]]. She emits blue flames with text reading "Imperial Edict" which is how she launches aircraft from her [[flight deck]] [[scroll]]. 

She talks in [[kansaiben|Kansai-ben]]. She is often nicknamed "RJ" and, with her cap, somewhat resembles a [[McDonald's]] worker. Near-constant victim of [[flat chest joke]]s in fanworks. Ironically, in game she is proud of her "distinctive silhouette" and never seems [[breast envy|envious]] of other girls' bosoms.

title: suzuya_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Suzuya[/i]. Designed by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]] with a [[hairclip]] and [[aqua eyes]]. She wears a brown [[school uniform]] with an orange [[ascot]], brown [[jacket]] and [[pleated skirt]], [[brown thighhighs]], and black [[loafers]] that have high heels. Her [[rigging]] includes multiple [[ship turret]]s with twin-[[cannon]] arrangements strapped two to her forearms, one on each thigh, and a larger one carried by a strap like a purse. She carries a mast like a backpack.

She has an energetic and informal personality, behaving like a typical high-school girl, with little sense of personal space and a frisky attitude. She's also frequently shown as being rather close to her sister-ship, [[Kumano (kancolle)|]].

title: kumano_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kumano[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Like [[Suzuya (kancolle)|]], she wears a brown [[school uniform]] ([[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]], [[brown skirt]], [[brown thighhighs]]) and [[black footwear|black]] shoes.

Her [[rigging]] consists of all five 20.3 cm twin gun mounts plus two 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose mounts]] at base form but she discards the two left arm-mounted 20.3 cm mounts at kai form in favor of a [[flight deck]].

In stark contrast to her sister Suzuya, she speaks in a respectful and formal manner, evoking an ojou-sama type. However, she screams like a dolphin in battle. The scream itself (likened to a dolphin sound) is a meme.

title: low_tier_god
body:
[b]Dalauan Sparrow[/b] is an American [[Twitch.tv|Twitch]] streamer specialized in [[fighting game]]s.

He is notorious for his tendency to became tilted, ragequit, and use numerous obscene profanities whenever he is losing. His catchpahse "[[You should kill yourself NOW (meme)|]]!" later spawned a [[meme]].

title: amatsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Amatsukaze[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle, decorated with windsocks acting as [[hair tubes]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[brown_dress|brown]] [[short_dress|short]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[grey neckerchief]] and [[lifebuoy]] clip, [[black hat|black]] [[mini hat]] styled after her real-life funnel, [[black choker]], [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white glove]] on her right hand, [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her own [[Rensouhou-kun]] on a bow hull piece to her right and quad 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] to her back.

She is implied to be a [[tsundere]]. As the historical [i]Amatsukaze[/i] was the testbed for [[Shimakaze (kancolle)|]]'s turbines, she is, in a way, Shimakaze's elder sister.

title: takanami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Takanami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with notable long [[sidelocks]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]], with a [[yellow sports bra]] underneath her shirt. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back with a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She has a personality that is lacking in confidence. Her verbal tic is "かも" or "kamo", which usually means "maybe". The homophone "kamo" (written "鴨") can also mean [[duck]], so she is sometimes seen with ducks for this reason. This verbal tic is shared with [[Akitsushima (Kancolle)|]], who was introduced at the same time.

title: matoimaru_(arknights)
body:
[i]Matoimaru, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, will wield her blade to wipe out the enemy.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 3[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Oni[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An excellent Oni warrior from Higashi. She exudes an incredibile bloodlust during combat, although she seems unaware fo this fact and forgets about these episodes. She fights with a [[naginata]].

She likes playing soccer and making flower arrengaments, which are described by others as very refined. She often organizes events around these subjects and drags other people in them, willing or not.

Her motif is likely based on the [[Ushi-oni]] yokai.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ōtsu Airi (Japanese), Qiwen (Chinese), and Chae Min-ji (Korean). Her art designer is [[ryuuzaki ichi]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #3565076: Default
* !post #3565077: Elite II

title: mr._peabody_&_sherman
body:
A Jay Ward Productions property, originating out of [[Rocky & Bullwinkle]]. The original segment from the show, entitled "Peabody's Improbable History", features a genius dog named Mr. Peabody who adopts a human named Sherman. Every episode features the two of them using the Wayback Machine to go back in time to observe a historic figure. 

The segment would in the 2010s be spun-off into its own property, beginning first with the 2014 computer animated film by [[Dreamworks]], before being followed up by "The Mr. Peabody & Sherman Show," which aired on Netflix from 2015 to 2017.

title: shikinami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shikinami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]]. She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]], and [[brown eyes]]. She and [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] wear a [[brown sailor collar]] version of the Fubuki-class [[serafuku]], complete with a [[brown skirt]]. In real life, [i]Shikinami[/i] was part of DesDiv19 alongside her sister [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] and her half-sisters [[Isonami (kancolle)|]] and [[Uranami (kancolle)|]]. She first saw action in the battle of the Sunda Strait where she fired the torpedo that sank [[Houston (Kancolle)|]]. Later seeing action in the [[battle of Midway]] and Naval Guadalcanal, she rescued [[Shirayuki (Kancolle)|]]'s survivors in the battle of the Bismarck Sea and spent the rest of her combat duty as a convoy escort, where she was sunk in one of these in September 1944. h4. Appearance * !post #3226378: Base * !post #3775600: [[Shikinami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #2804886: [[shikinami (yukata) (kancolle)|Yukata]] * !post #8731590: [[shikinami_(maizuru)_(kancolle)|Maizuru]] h4. [i]Ayanami[/i]-class destroyers * [[Ayanami (Kancolle)|]] * [b]Shikinami[/b] * Asagiri (Yet to be implemented) * Yuugiri (Yet to be implemented) * [[Amagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Oboro (Kancolle)|]] * [[Akebono (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sazanami (Kancolle)|]] * [[Ushio (Kancolle)|]] h4. External links * "Kancolle Wiki: Shikinami":https://en.kancollewiki.net/Shikinami * "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer [i]Shikinami[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Shikinami_(1929)]

title: teruzuki_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Teruzuki (kancolle)|]]. While considered an official costume, it has remained unreleased in the game apart from the 2018 calendar.

Her swimsuit consists of a [[white bikini]] worn with [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]].

title: mikuma_(2016_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

It consists of a plain [[red bikini]] and matching red [[flippers]], with a [[bodyboard]] carrying her real-life seaplane deck pattern and her nickname "Kumarinko" printed on it. The outfit gained notoriety for its [[bad anatomy]] and was never repeated, instead opting to go for a [[Mikuma (2017 swimsuit) (kancolle)|new swimsuit design]] that's been used since 2017.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2440523

title: mogami_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mogami (kancolle)|]].

Her base/kai swimsuit consists of a [[multicolored bikini|tricolor bikini]] top and [[white bikini]] bottom worn beneath a [[white jacket]], and grey [[sandals]]. It matches with [[Mikuma (2017 swimsuit) (kancolle)|Mikuma's own]] swimsuit costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2804866

title: mikuma_(2017_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The current [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

Following backlash to Mikuma's [[Mikuma (2016 swimsuit) (kancolle)|original swimsuit design]], she gained a new design that fixed the problems with the original. Her current swimsuit outfit consists of a [[green bikini]] top and [[white bikini]] bottom worn beneath a [[white jacket]], a [[white headband]], and brown [[sandals]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2804873

title: haruna_(2016_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Haruna (kancolle)|]], exclusive to her [[Haruna Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] form. It was replaced in 2023 with a [[Haruna (2023 swimsuit) (kancolle)|new swimsuit design]].

She wears a [[white bikini]] under a [[white jacket]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sandals]] with [[strappy heels]], a single [[thigh strap]] containing an AA gun, and red [[bracelet]]s. Uniquely, her actual bikini was hidden from view until she was at least moderately damaged.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3226123: With jacket
* !post #2440775: Without jacket

title: haruna_(2023_swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The currently-used [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Haruna (kancolle)|]], exclusive to her [[Haruna Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni ]] form. Revealed in conjunction with her Kai Ni C, it replaced her [[Haruna (2016 swimsuit) (kancolle)|original swimsuit design]].

She is portrayed with a [[black bikini]] worn under a [[white jacket]] and [[black shorts]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sandals]], and carrying a 356 mm twin gun mount on her side.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6571125: Swimsuit kai ni

title: mikuma_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The two second remodels of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]].

Her kai ni [[serafuku]] is colored to match her sister [[Mogami (Kancolle)|]]: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[brown serafuku]] with a [[yellow sailor collar]] and a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. Her back funnel and mast-and-[[radar]] set are retained as well, plus her three 203 mm twin gun mounts (two on her legs and one handheld). Beyond this, her [[rigging]] takes two different forms depending on her specific kai ni.

In standard CAV kai ni, she retains her [[flight deck]]. In her alternate [i]Toku[/i] kai ni, she is reclassed as a transport cruiser/seaplane tender (AV) and her old flight deck is replaced with a new one that includes a large catapult, hangar, and a well deck for amphibious craft. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7137317: CAV Kai Ni
* !post #7137326: Transport cruiser

h4. [i]Mogami[/i]-class cruisers - kai ni

* [[Mogami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Mogami]] (CAV and transport cruiser)
* [b]Mikuma[/b] (CAV and transport/AV)
* [[Suzuya Kai Ni (kancolle)|Suzuya]] (CAV and CVL)
* [[Kumano Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kumano]] (CAV and CVL)

title: bright_slap
body:
A character [[slap]]ping or having slapped another character to beat some sense into them.

Named after [[Bright Noa]] from [[Gundam]], captain of both [[White Base]] and the [[Argama]], who was famous for delivering this kind of treatment to [[Amuro Ray]].

h4. See also
* [[Gundam Aerial slap (meme)]]

h4. External links
* "TVTropes: Get a Hold of Yourself, Man!":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GetAHoldOfYourselfMan
other_names: 親父にもぶたれたことないのに!

title: nagae_iku
body:
The "Beautiful Scarlet Cloth". Sub-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]][/i] and playable character in that and [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]].

A celestial and messenger of the Dragon Palace who came to [[Gensokyo]] to warn its citizens of a massive earthquake, having the ability to read the atmosphere. She uses her [[hagoromo]] as a weapon (most notably as a [[drill]]), but is best remembered for her spellcard activation pose, which is similar to that used by [[John Travolta]] in the film [[Saturday Night Fever]] or [[Great Mazinger_(robot)|Great Mazinger's]] Thunder Break. Hinted to be a nanny figure to [[Hinanawi Tenshi]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Iku Nagae":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Iku_Nagae

title: raised_eyebrows
body:
When a character's eyebrows are elevated from the usual resting position.

Use [[raised inner eyebrows]] instead when only the inner ends are raised, while the outer ends remain lowered.

Use [[v-shaped eyebrows]] instead when only the outer ends are raised, while the inner ends point downwards in a V shape.

h4. Examples

* !post #3333779
* !post #5913552
* !post #7925192
* !post #6150211

h4.  See also

* [[furrowed brow]]
* [[raised eyebrow]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: list_of_flower_knight_girl_characters
body:
This is an alphabetical list of all tagged characters in [[DMM]]'s online browser game [[Flower Knight Girl]]. The player commands an army comprising of female [[personification|personifications]] of various [[flower|flowers]] and angiosperm plants to do battle against insects.

The Japanese names for flowers (and some genus names as well) are used on Danbooru rather than the English, when applicable. The English names are listed in each character's wiki, as well as Nutaku's official name for the character when applicable. Some characters will have a known official artist linked in their wiki as well. Characters with 10+ posts are highlighted in [i]italic[/i]. Characters with 50+ posts are highlighted in [b]bold[/b].

h4. Characters

title: suzuya_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Suzuya (Kancolle)|]]'s Kai Ni form comes in two types: aviation heavy cruiser and light aircraft carrier.

On her second remodel, the uniform is replaced by a open brown [[cardigan]] with a lighter brown vest, and now the [[flight deck]] is the one having a strap, being carried like a shoulder bag. Her damaged portrait shows her wearing a [[purple bra]].

Her third remodel - a light carrier version - replaces her turret with a crossbow and her flight deck is much larger. This requires an additional blueprint since this is a hypothetical remodel based on the [[Ibuki (Azur Lane)|]]'s real-life conversion from CA to CVL (as Ibuki shared a largely identical hull to the Mogami-class.)

h4. Appearance

* !post #2681932: Second remodel
* !post #2681945: Third remodel
* !post #4311200: [[Suzuya Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

title: makigumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Makigumo (Kancolle)|]]. 

Her winter version consists of a grey [[blazer]] over the standard Yuugumo-class uniform which now has a sheer black underskirt and her pantyhose being reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Her hairstyle gains a [[crown braid]]. Distinctly though, her blazer has absurdly long sleeves like in her base form which cover her hands upon damage. However, while undamaged, said sleeves are folded just high up enough to expose her hands.

She later gets the summer variant: a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs. This however means that her hands are fully exposed in this uniform.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3319127: Winter
* !post #4645614: Summer
* !post #4037934: [[Makigumo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

title: kazagumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Kazagumo (Kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]].

The winter uniform consists of a short grey [[blazer]] over a [[dress]] with a sheer black underskirt. Her [[pantyhose]] has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Because she wears a [[necktie]] on her base form rather than a large bowtie like her sisters do, she accordingly switches to an [[ascot]] to match her remodel. On her damaged CG, one can still see a [[camisole]] undernath, implying she does not gain even a slightly larger bustline with the remodel, unlike even [[Makigumo Kai Ni (kancolle)|]], who now wears a bra on remodel.

The summer uniform consists of a grey and violet [[vest]] (its two tones being full view due to her keeping the ascot) over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs.

title: pola_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Pola[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Akasaki Chinatsu]].

She has [[grey_hair|gray]] [[wavy hair]], grayish [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a black [[bodice]] over a [[white shirt]], [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]] with [[anchor|anchors]] attached, [[red bowtie]], [[white hat|white]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life fire-control director, [[white thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is just like her sister [[Zara (Kancolle)|]]'s: two hull pieces containing her four 203 mm twin gun mounts. 

She is often portrayed [[drunk]] or as a heavy [[wine]] drinker. This is in reference to her sinking, when her surviving crew were rescued intoxicated.

title: sendai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sendai[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: an [[orange shirt]] with [[white sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels on her ankles, 14 cm gun mounts on both of her elbow gloves (with an additional [[aircraft catapult]] on her right), and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her [[black belt]]. 

She seems obsessed with night battles, on account of her historical battle record. Her obsession is so strong that she is also known as the "[[Night Battle Idiot]]" in-game. The phrase "night battle" is often used as a [[euphemism]] for [[sex]] in KanColle fan works. Her name can also be read as "Kawauchi", which is sometimes used to refer to her in a teasing way.

h4. Appearance

title: kamikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Kamikaze[/i], lead ship of the [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class destroyers. Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], reddish-[[purple hair]] which [[gradient_hair| gradually fades]] to [[pink hair|pink]] at the ends, tied with a [[yellow ribbon]]. 

Kamikaze and her sisters wear traditional [[Japanese clothes]], namely a [[pink hakama]] over a [[red kimono]] paired with [[lace-up boots]] in the style of a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]], in reference to how she and her sisters were built during the [[Taishou]] era (when this style of dress was still common).

She doesn't want to be seen as old, despite being of the oldest destroyer class in the game and her old-fashioned looks. That being said, she has an excellent war record for her capabilities.

Kamikaze is related in some way to all four of the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class:

* She was part of Destroyer Division 1, which was part of the 5th fleet, led by [[nachi (kancolle)|Nachi]] during the battle of Attu.
* She was under the command of [[haguro (kancolle)|Haguro]] (and protected by her) during the Battle of Malacca Strait. Kamikaze saved some of Haguro's survivors after the battle.
* She was under [[Ashigara (kancolle)|Ashigara]]'s command until her sinking and also saved some of her survivors.
* She surrendered along with the crippled [[myoukou (kancolle)|Myoukou]] (and Takao) at Singapore.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has no relation to the [[kamikaze pilot]]s who conducted suicide attacks on Allied ships later in World War II.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24837315: Base
* !asset #24837316: [[Kamikaze (Valentine) (Kancolle)|Valentine]]
* !post #3625817: [[Kamikaze (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]]

title: kiyoshimo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Kiyoshimo (Kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a variant of the class' kai-ni uniform: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey jacket|grey]] [[collared jacket]] over the usual [[purple dress]], [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[high heels|high-heel]] [[lace-up boots]], but now sports black [[partially fingerless gloves]] and [[grey thighhighs]] instead of pantyhose. 

Her [[rigging]] remains identical, differing only in that instead of two quad [[torpedo tubes]], she now only has one: the other is replaced with [[depth charge]]s. She also gains an additional 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] (or depth charges in ASW form) on her left collar.

body:
The swimsuit [[official alternate costume]] of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (kancolle)|]]. 

It consists of a bikini (initially mistaken for a [[casual one-piece swimsuit]]) hidden beneath a [[grey hoodie|grey]] [[hooded jacket]], [[brown belt|brown]] [[ammunition belt]], and black [[sandals]]. The color of her swimsuit differs between base kai ni and kai ni D (anti-submarine) forms: it is blue at base and white at anti-sub mode. Her alternate "battleship" modes remove the jacket, revealing the bikini underneath.

title: makigumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Makigumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She has [[pink hair]] with [[double bun]] and [[twintails]], [[yellow eyes]], and large [[glasses]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] [[sleeves_past_wrists|that go past her wrists]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back (with a rabbit on the funnel), a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: isuzu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Isuzu[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue_hair|dark blue hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sisters Nagara and Natori: a [[white shirt]] with a [[brown sailor collar]] and [[detached sleeves]], white [[hair bow]]s for her twintails, [[brown neckerchief]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels to her back, connecting platforms that have her 12.7 cm twin gun mounts, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]], and a [[searchlight]] and 12.7 cm twin gun mount on a [[bullpup]] stock. 

Initially infamous for her low remodeling level (12), she became valuable for farming, which can give you a radar and enhanced AA stats if used as modernization fodder. 

h4. Skins

* !post #2442865: [[Isuzu kai ni (kancolle)|]]

title: umikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Umikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied in a single [[braid]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her left eye]]. Her default outfit is a modified version of the class' [[black serafuku]] with [[detached sleeves]], featuring a large white stripe on the front of the blouse, [[blue neckerchief]], [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[mary janes]]. 

She has a serious and eager personality, and tends to worry over her sister-ship, [[Kawakaze (Kancolle)|]].

title: suzutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] tied [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[white bodysuit]], [[grey jacket]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (suzutsuki's)|]]. Upon remodel her [[hachimaki]] becomes white, the writing changes from "61st Destroyer Division" to "41st Destroyer Division", and her Chou-10cm-hou-chan gains a set of 25mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts.

h4. Appearance

title: kasumi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kasumi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[side ponytail]], [[yellow_eyes|yellowish]]-[[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

She is notorious as the worst verbally abusive shipgirl. Yes, she is even more foul-mouthed than [[akebono (kancolle)|Akebono]]. She often treats her [[admiral (kancolle)|Admiral]] as a dumb servant and is constantly hardheaded and irritated. However this only hides her [[tsundere|feelings]] especially when you marry her; she gets flustered more often.

title: tenryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Tenryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Ayaki]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and an [[eyepatch]] covering her left eye. Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], checkered [[black necktie]], [[black jacket]]/[[cardigan]], [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is semi-futuristic in theme and consists of her real-life bridge to her back with two 14 cm single gun mounts, and floating [[headgear]]. 

Depicted with a tough girl personality with the catchphrase of "Heh, you scared?"; she is, however, often depicted in a way that subverts this generally because her stats are very sub-par for her ship type and is generally used as expedition fleet fodder rather than part of a combat fleet. She is also depicted as a babysitter to the destroyers due to her low fuel cost.

title: pramanix_(arknights)
body:
[i]Pramanix, Karlan Saintess, is willing to send holy blessings to you as a Supporter Operator[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Enya Silverash

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kjerag[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]½ year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A somewhat polite and quiet girl, she is the Karlan Saintess and supreme leader of the entire religion in the country of Kjerag. She is also the second of the Silverash siblings, being the older sister of [[cliffheart_(arknights)|Encia "Cliffheart" Silverash]] and the younger sister of [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodas Silverash]]. How she came to Rhodes Island and her employment by them is confidential.

Despite her stature, she is quite a lazy bum and always slacking off, given any chance.

Just like her siblings, her motif is based on the snow leopard.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[hayami saori|Saori Hayami]].

title: gotoh_hitori
body:
Main character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]]. Also known by her titular nickname "Bocchi", an introverted girl with an exceptional skill at playing [[guitar]]. She struggled to find any friends due to her social anxiety until she joined the Kessoku Band at the request of [[Ijichi Nijika]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[one side up]], [[large breasts]] (according to ch. 4 of the manga)  & [[hair between eyes]] (sometimes depicted with [[hair over eyes]]). She usually wears a [[cube hair ornament]], a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[track jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Other times depicted wearing [[pink pants|pink]] [[track pants|track]] [[pants under skirt|pants under her skirt]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] the [[Gibson Les Paul]] [[Electric Guitar]], which she is usually depicted [[holding instrument|holding]] or keeping in [[instrument case|guitar case]].

She is voiced by [[Aoyama Yoshino]] and portrayed by [[Morino Mamo]] in the stage-play.

Not to be confused with [[Hitori Bocchi]] from [i][[Hitoribocchi no Marumaru Seikatsu]][/i].

h4. See also
* [[Gotoh Hitori (tsuchinoko)]]
* [[Gotoh Hitori (octopus)]]
* "Bocchi's Stress-induced Transformations":[/pools/20401]

title: saileach_(arknights)
body:
[i]Standard-bearer Saileach has come to Rhodes Island from County Hillock.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Jane "Janie" Willow

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 31[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former Victorian ceremonial standard bearer, she served at the Victorian Army Barracks in County Hillock, where the head of the local Rhodes Island branch office presented her as a liaison operator. She has basic Victorian Army training under her belt, superior physical ability, and demonstrated a talent for support operations. Peers regard her as compassionate, friendly, carries herself with due elegance, idealistic and an extraordinary cook; generally regarded by the fandom as the game's take on the [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] archetype.

Her callsign is the Irish term for her surname, [i]willow[/i]. Her [[saileach (elite ii) (arknights)|second promotion]] art depicts a [[naga]] in reference to her Sargonian lineage. Uses a [[rapier]] and a blue-and-yellow Victorian banner in battle.

One of the main characters of the story [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tomatsu Haruka]] (Japanese), Yuan Weng (Chinese), Meaghan Martin (English), and Kim Sun-hye (Korean). Her art designer is [[Xiayehongming]].

h4. Skins

title: tsushima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Tsushima[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]], voiced by [[Imamura Ayaka]] (initial) and [[Seto Asami]] (after Imamura's retirement). 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient_hair|gradient]], and [[two-tone eyes|two-tone]] [[purple eyes|purple]]-[[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Etorofu[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], [[white gloves]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, additional depth charges slung to her side, and a [[blue ribbon|blue]] ankle ribbon.

As a coastal defense ship, her class is even smaller than destroyers, and as such, she is portrayed as an "elementary school student" character, even younger than the generally "middle school" appearances of the destroyers. She comes off as having a cool personality.

The seventh member of the class, she was transferred to Taiwan post-war as ROCS [i]Lin An[/i], serving until 1963. She is named after "Tsushima Island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsushima_Island]  at the Korea Strait between South Korea and Japan. The island is also known as Daemado (대마도) as Changwon City, South Korea "lays claim to the island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_claim_to_Tsushima_Island], but not South Korea itself.

title: mutsu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] obtained her second remodel with the 27 February 2019 update.

She obtained a new outfit similar to [[Nagato Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Nagato]] before her, the differences (outside of color) being a v-neck instead of a [[turtleneck]] and draped half-sleeves + short gloves instead of short sleeves ending in long gloves. Her gear has been upgraded to triple 41cm guns superfiring over twin 41cm guns. Her stats have also been improved, with a stat spread similar to Nagato's own Kai2 and improved luck.

title: kitakami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kitakami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with the back in a long [[braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her base outfit, shared with her sister [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[green shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]] with white stripes, and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her base [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]] mount, and twin 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left arm.

Her personality goes all over the place. Sometimes, she's a genuinely nice girl; other times, "she trolls":/pools/7431 [[Abukuma (Kancolle)|]]. She often expresses her annoyance with the destroyers. She is likes to boast of her abilities, such as referring herself as "Super Kitakami-sama" after remodeling.

The nature of her relationship with [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]] varies but they are usually very close to each other. In some versions, Kitakami is straight while Ooi is a lesbian, and Kitakami has to repeatedly shred Ooi's delusions. In others, they're a romantic couple. In yet further versions, they're both bisexual and have eyes for the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] and each other.  

h4. Appearance

title: tan_yang_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] kai form, after being transferred to the Republic of China ([[Taiwan]]).

She wears a [[red shirt|red]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar|grey]] [[sailor collar]] and [[brown neckerchief]] over a [[white dress|white]] stylized [[china dress]]. She wears more modernized communications [[headgear]] and dual-anchor [[hairclip]]s (which are miniature versions of the ROC Navy emblem) and sports [[machinery]] which includes Type 89 12.7 cm/40 dual mounted guns as well as new Taiwanese weapons due to the ROC Navy having no access to the original Japanese armaments. Her [[rudder footwear|rudder boots]] sport the number 12, in reference to her new hull number DD-12. Noticeable immediately is that Tan Yang dresses more conservatively with a slightly longer dress compared to either Yukikaze in base form or in her official second remodel.

Her name can also be romanized as "Danyang" in Hanyu Pinyin instead of Wade-Giles. The game officially uses the Hanyu Pinyin romanization, but the Wade-Giles one is used here for historical reasons as well as the tendency for Taiwanese to shun the mainland-formulated Pinyin.

Even before she was added to the game, some fan artists had already created their own versions of Tan Yang, either through [[original remodel (kantai collection)|]]s, mere associations with Taiwan, or juxtapositions with anything vaguely Chinese in general, [[AceA4]] being one prominent example.

title: kamoi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Kamoi[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Seto Asami]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[white_hair|white]] on the outside, [[blue_hair|blue]] on the inside and the eyebrows) and tied to a [[folded ponytail]] with a [i]matanpus[/i] [[headband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Each of her forms has her wear some variant of a blue [[cropped jacket]] over a long, [[sleeveless_dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] with [[thighhighs]]. In her base form her thighhighs are black bandages. In her [[Kamoi Kai (kancolle)|Kai]] form she wears [[thigh boots]]. In [[Kamoi Kai Bo (kancolle)|Kai Bo]] form her headband loses its pattern.

She was one of a few Japanese ships in-game to be built abroad (besides [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]]). In her case, at New York Shipbuilding Corporation, at the same time as [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]], before her conversion (for this reason, [i]she[/i] is the key for building Saratoga with LSC). However, she shows very little traces of her birthland and instead acts as the token minority of the fleet. Her design is heavily influenced by the [[Ainu]], featuring distinctive patterning as well as a [[ainu_clothes|few clothing items]] and objects. 

She is the only ship in the game to change ship class three times as well as the only ship who irreversibly (but nominally) return to their original ship class. As Kai Bo, she is the only other ship other than [[akitsushima (kancolle)|Akitsushima]] to field Flying Boats.

title: magical_girl
body:
A magical girl (魔法少女, [i]mahou shoujo[/i]) is a young girl with magical abilities, typically being chosen to fight evil and to protect the Earth by a "mascot" familiar. They often possess a secret identity they [[transformation|transform]] into through a [[henshin]] sequence, although the name can just refer to young girls who follow a plotline involving magic and a transformation.

On Danbooru this tag is used for characters dressed in a magical girl outfit.

title: sten_gun
body:
The [b]STEN[/b] (or [b]Sten gun[/b]) was a family of blowback operated, open bolt 9×19mm [[submachine gun]]s, used by [[united kingdom|British]] and Commonwealth forces throughout [[World War II]] since 1941 and the [[Korean War]]. They were notable for having a simple design and very low production cost, making them effective insurgency [[weapon]]s for resistance groups. Sten's overall appearance resembles a metal tube with a side-mounted [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] insertion on the left side.

The acronym "STEN" originated from the names of the [[weapon]]'s chief designers - Major Reginald V. [b]S[/b]hepherd, Harold [b]T[/b]urpin and [b]En[/b]field. Sten guns were produced in several basic marks, one of the most common one is the Mk II. 

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MP 3008]]
* [[Sten MkII (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Sterling SMG]]

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sten

title: sauron
body:
One of the main antagonists in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

He was a Maia, an [[angel]]ic being in the Legendarium, who was corrupted by [[Morgoth]] and became a Dark Lord bent on controlling the world of Middle-earth. He is the main antagonist of [[The Lord of the Rings]] trilogy and was ultimately defeated after the destruction of [[the One Ring]].

He took on many forms with many names throughout his existence:

* Mairon, his original Maia name
* Annatar, a persona he took on to deceive the Elves into forging the Rings of Power
* [[Eye of Sauron]], a symbol of Sauron

title: chemise
body:
A chemise is essentially a [[camisole|camisole]] that ends past the waist. Usually worn as an undergarment.

In modern usage, a chemise is generally a woman's garment that vaguely resembles the older shirts but is typically more delicate, and usually provocative. Most commonly the term refers to a loose-fitting, sleeveless undergarment or type of [[lingerie]] which is unfitted at the waist. It can also refer to a short, sleeveless dress that hangs straight from the shoulders and fits loosely at the waist. A chemise typically does not have any buttons or other fasteners and is put on by either dropping it over the head or stepping into it and lifting it up. Its usually on the plainer side, being worn under clothes to smoothe the silhouette. 

As lingerie, a chemise is similar to a [[babydoll]], which is also a short, loose-fitting, sleeveless garment. Typically, though, babydolls are more loose-fitting at the hips and are generally designed to more resemble a young girl's [[nightgown]], although many modern styles have added various sexualizing features. Babydolls also have an [[empire waist]], which chemises do not. 

h4. Examples

* !post #1502701
* !post #6550712

h4. See also

* [[Babydoll]]
* [[Camisole]]
* [[Lingerie]]
* [[Nightgown]]

title: megalodontia_(splatoon)
body:
Megalodontia is the biggest King [[Salmonid]] that appears in Xtrawaves of [[salmon_run_(splatoon)|salmon run]] in [[splatoon 3|Splatoon 3]]. (Humorously described as "1.4 Boats wide")

It shares similarities with [[maws_(splatoon)|Maws]]. It has [[bulging_eyes|bulging]] [[blank_eyes|white eyes]] and a pair of pants held with suspenders. It also has a tuft of [[blue_hair|blue hair]] and a contraption around its jaws resembling orthodontic [[braces]]. It's back is covered in various fishing nets as well as a red hump.

title: phlogistinator
body: The Phlogistinator (also Phlog for short) is a retrofuturistic primary weapon for the [[team_fortress_2|TF2]] [[pyro_(tf2)|Pyro]]. It is shaped like a blunderbuss with silver and copper metal parts and a canister attached to it. It fires waves of energy that functions similarly to a flamethrower.

title: sopralto
body:
Sopralto also known as Moru Onpu is a female American/Vietnamese Independent VTuber who streams on Twitch.

h4. Profile

Sopralto (a.k.a. Soppy) is an average guinea pig by day and a [[magical girl]] by night. Originally, she was just a humble class pet, but one night she wished to be able to communicate with her beloved classroom children. The next day she woke up from her sleep to see she was no longer just a guinea pig, but now a guinea pig girl. She now spends her days eating the lettuce her students give her and vows to do whatever it takes to keep them happy. Being introduced to streaming by one of the kids, she now streams in her free time to fuel her lettuce addiction.

h4. External links

* "Twitch":https://www.twitch.tv/Sopralto
* "Twitter":https://x.com/The_Sopralto

title: heavy_gundam
body:
A fictional giant manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]FA-78-2 Heavy Gundam[/b]

The evolution of the [[Heavy Full Armor Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], it had much beefier armor built into the unit as opposed to added on top, more powerful thrusters, which remedied the FA-78-1's horrid maneuverability, and omitted the Core Block System for more armor. It also received a new weapon system, the Frame Launcher, which mounted a huge Gatling gun and missile launchers. The shoulder launched rocket launcher of the FA Gundam was replaced with a much more powerful beam cannon.

title: black_speech_(language)
body: One of the languages constructed by J. R. R. Tolkien for his [[Tolkien's legendarium|legendarium]]. Itself a constructed langauage in-universe, it was created by [[Sauron]] to serve as the language of his forces in [[Mordor]]. Tolkien seldom wrote about the Black Speech, and it is best known for being the language inscribed on the [[The One Ring|One Ring]], written in a stylized [[Tengwar text|Tengwar]] script.

title: tequila_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator Tequila, all smiles on the battlefield too.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: Ernesto Salas

The son of Bolívarian militant [[Pancho Salas (arknights)|]], and [[La Pluma (arknights)|]]'s brother. The former director of the International Trade Management Department of Dossoles.

After the incident in Dossoles City, he joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[Ch'en (arknights)|]].

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i].

His motif is based on the golden retriever.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]] (Japanese), Zhengwu Wenjie (Chinese), and Kim Sin-woo (Korean). His art designer is [[Kang Yiqian (self cultivation)|]].

title: maruyama_hiroshi
body:
A Japanese illustrator, and character designer, particularly in [[tokusatsu]] and anime.

He originally worked for [[Tsuburaya Productions]], as he did most of the character designs for the [[Ultra Series]], mainly in the Heisei era, from [[Ultraman Tiga|Tiga]] to [[Ultraman Mebius|Mebius]].

After stepping down as the main character designer for the Ultra Series, as well as departing from the company, he then did the creature designs for the [[Battle Spirits]] franchise, as well as the character designs of the [[Phantom (Kamen Rider Wizard)|Phantoms]] from [[Kamen Rider Wizard (series)|]].

title: tanikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i], the fourteenth ship of the Kagerou-class destroyers.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[white hairband|white]] [[hairband]]. Like her division mates from the 17th Destroyer Division, she wears a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] and blue button-up [[serafuku]] with a yellow scarf (similar to [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]) on top of a Kagerou-class standard [[pleated skirt]] along with [[white thighhighs]]. On her back is her [[rigging]], with an attached [[depth charge]]. Like most of the Kagerou-class, she wears [[white gloves]]. She [[dual wielding|dual wields]] two [[handgun]]s, one resembling the standard 12.7 cm twin gun, the other resembling an anti-air gun.

She speaks like a stereotypical [[Edoben|Edokko]] despite being built in Osaka. Thus, she is the opposite of [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] (who speaks in [[Kansaiben]] but was built in Yokohama, just nearby Tokyo). Also, because of her accent, she has a good relationship with [[Suzukaze (kancolle)|]] who shares the same accent, and is sometimes shown sprouting [[Buront]]isms.

She is a frequent victim of [[breast envy]] due the fact that she is only one in 17th Destroyers Division who has a [[flat chest]] and is often compared with her sisters and division mates [[Urakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hamakaze (kancolle)|]] who have [[large breasts]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24758453: Base
* !asset #24758483: [[Tanikaze D Kai (Kancolle)|D Kai]]
* !asset #24758456: [[Tanikaze (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wiki: Tanikaze":https://en.kancollewiki.net/Tanikaze
* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Tanikaze_(1940)

May depict the act of [[biting ear]] or [[imminent bite|imminent biting]].

It may have started with "this tweet":https://twitter.com/kannkannna/status/1731996672807600503 of [[Kan Kanna]] and [[Tsukine Kona]] (asset #24838068). post #7159043 may be the first instance of this phenomenon drawn.

title: steven_armstrong
body:
[b]Senator Steven Armstrong[/b] is the main antagonist of [i][[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]][/i].

An independent US Senator and presidential hopeful from Colorado, [spoiler]Armstrong runs World Marshall and is responsible for triggering the series of events of the game.[/spoiler] Before then, he had attended the University of Texas before joining the US Navy, though the details of his service record are unknown. His ultimate goal is to start a war between the US and Pakistan [spoiler]and use it as a means to win the Presidential elections and turn America into a Ultra-individualistic Social Darwinist state.[/spoiler]

His bombastic personality and raw physical prowess (having fought [[raiden_(metal_gear)|Raiden]] to a standstill) has lent itself to a number of notable [[meme]]s, most famously concerning the fact that he was [[nanomachines_son!_(meme)|at some point injected with nanomachines]] that harden in response to physical trauma.

h4. See also
* [[Raiden punching Armstrong (meme)]]
* [[Nanomachines son! (meme)]]
other_names: スティーヴン・アームストロング
スティーブン・アームストロング

title: vergil_status_(meme)
body:
Recurring [[meme]] where [[Vergil (Devil May Cry)|]] from [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] interrupts (usually sensitive) content with Judgment Cut End while an unofficial edit of "Bury the Light" (more specifically the a capella "I am the storm that is approaching" chorus) plays in the background.

The meme itself an offshoot of a previous meme called "Revengeance Status" where the same sensitive content is also interrupted, but this time with a character from [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]] (typically [[Steven Armstrong|Senator Armstrong]], Monsoon, or [[Samuel Rodrigues|Jetstream Sam]]).

title: laundry_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 2
[b]Attribute:[/b] Water
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can send the top 3 cards of your Deck to the GY. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Laundry Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Her dragon form is [[Dragonmaid Nudyarl]]. Can be easily distinguished by her blue/purple [[wa maid]] uniform.

As the youngest-looking member of the archetype (as well as her artwork), she is depicted as being childish and clumsy. She is also occasionally paired with [[Eldlich the Golden Lord]] in fanart due to a series of fanarts by [[Hatano Kiyoshi]] referring to her supposed synergy in Eldlich decks. She is also often paired with [[Parlor Dragonmaid]], who is often depicted as her "sister figure".

In fanart, Laundry Dragonmaid also has a rivalry with [[Tearlaments Merrli]] because both of them has the same "mill 3" effects that also synergizes with Tearlaments decks, albeit Laundry is deemed inferior due to her lacking built-in fusion ability that Merrli has. This trend in rivalry fanart shot up when Merlli got banned in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ラドリー
ドラゴンメイド・フルス

title: house_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 9
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Dragon monster
Once per turn, during the Standby Phase: You can target 1 other "Dragonmaid" monster you control; Special Summon 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY in Defense Position, whose Level is 1 higher or 1 lower than it. When another face-up Dragon monster(s) you control returns to your hand (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy it.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]], a member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] in her dragon form. As indicated from her title, she is the Dragonmaid archetype's head maid.

Although House Dragonmaid has Light attribute, her maid uniform color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color, this may due to her being inspired from a [[Victorian maid]].

House Dragonmaid is often depicted having a serious personality, she can get angry for [[Parlor Dragonmaid]] eating sweet sneakily or [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] doesn't have her laundry job done.

h4. See also

* [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] (dragon form)
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ハスキー
ドラゴンメイド・シュトラール

title: morgoth
body: In [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], [b]Morgoth[/b], meaning "Black Foe" or "Dark Enemy", was the name that the Elves gave to Melkor, the divine spirit that rebelled against the god Eru Iluvatar and became the original source of evil in the world. After his defeat, his role as Dark Lord was taken over by his trusted servant [[Sauron]].

title: marie_rose_(devilish_servant_against_the_splashing_waves)
body:
[[Marie Rose]]'s skin for [i]Vacation Lane[/i], [[Azur Lane]]'s collaboration with [[Dead or Alive Xtreme|Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation]].

It utilizes her Cymric [[one-piece swimsuit]], which first appeared as her second costume in [[Dead or Alive 5|Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate]] and then in [i]Dead or Alive Xtreme 3[/i], where it was given its name.

It consists of a [[blue one-piece swimsuit|blue]] [[frilled swimsuit|frilled]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[one-piece swimsuit]] with a [[red bow]]. The fighting costume version adds [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], and [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[blue thighhighs]].

h4. Official art

* !post #4221891

title: changchun_(warship_girls_r)
body:
The personification of the Chinese guided missile destroyer [i]Changchun[/i] in [[Warship Girls R]]. She is the modified form of [[Reshitelny (warship girls r)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]], and wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]], [[white thighhighs]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] with a [[red star]] [[star hat ornament|ornament]]. Her alternate costume "The One and Only" is the same, but with a [[white dress]] sailor dress and short [[blue socks]]. Her [[machinery|ship parts]] include a [[thigh strap]] on her right leg with a gun turret mounted on it, and uniquely for Warship Girls R ship girls she has a pair of [[missile launcher]]s.

title: diamond_clan_outfit
body:
The outfit worn by members of the Diamond Clan in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

It consists of a [[blue hoodie]] with a [[Dialga]]-themed hood, over what appears to be a [[black kimono|black]] and [[blue kimono|blue]] [[two-tone kimono]], and a [[brown bag]]. The hoodie has the Clan's emblem on its chest. The male outfit has [[brown pants|brown]] or [[grey pants]] while the female one has [[aqua leggings|aqua]] and [[blue leggings|blue]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[leggings]]. The outfit also has [[black boots|black]] and [[red boots|red]] [[boots]], which are longer in the male outfit.

While generic NPCs wear the same clothes, wardens wear variations of this outfit, mostly with some accessory, or pants or leggings with a different color.

title: lanterne_de_fantasmagorie
body: The [[Lanterne de Fantasmagorie]], otherwise known as Fantie, is the main protagonist from [[galleria no chika meikyuu to majo no ryodan|Labyrinth of Galleria: The Moon Society]]. [[Eureka de Soleil]] and [[Natyl Colbert]] use the lantern to explore the labyrinth within Galleria Manor.

title: military_combat_uniform
body:
A [[military uniform]] designed for combat, adorned with various equipment to help engage the enemy. [[Pouch]]es for extra storage, vision-enhancing [[goggles]], and armor such as [[bulletproof vest]]s are all a common sight, as is a set of [[military fatigues]] underneath.

Not to be confused with [[tactical clothes]], which is for non-military combat outfits ([[police_uniform|police]], [[S.W.A.T.]] etc).

h4. Examples

* !post #6686214

h4. See also

title: tetrahedron
body:
A [[polyhedron]] composed of four [[triangle|triangular]] faces. If all four faces are equilateral triangles, the tetrahedron is regular. Also known as a triangular [[pyramid (geometry)|]].

A compound of two regular tetrahedra is called a [[stellated octahedron]].

title: tetsujin_28-gou
body:
A 1956-1966 [[mecha]] manga series by [[Yokoyama Mitsuteru]]. It has been adapted into several media franchises. 

It is notable for being one of the first [[super robot]] anime series ever made.

h4. Works

* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (classic)|]] (1963-1966), first anime series, also known as [i]GIGANTOR[/i] in America.
* [[Taiyou no Shisha Tetsujin 28-gou]] (1980-1981), second anime series.
* Chou-dendou Robo: [[Tetsujin 28-gou FX]] (1992~1993)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (2004)]], fourth series, adaptation of original manga and anime set in 50s-60s.
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Hakuchuu no Zangetsu]] (2007 anime film)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Gao!]] (2013-2016)

h4. Characters

* [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]]
* [[Professor Shikishima]] (His first names varied depending on titles)
* [[Professor Furanken]]
* [[Cross Association]] ([i]Juuji Kessha[/i]) members
* [[Tetsujin 28]] (mecha)
* [[Black Ox]]
* [[Monster (tetsujin 28-gou)|]] 

h4. See also

* [[shota]] - the slang word "shotacon" was taken from [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]], main protagonist of this series

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tetsujin 28-go":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsujin_28-go

title: tetsujin_28-gou_(classic)
body:
The original manga and anime of the [[Tetsujin 28-gou]] series, first published from 1956 to 1966, while the anime ran from 1963 to 1966. It would later go on to serve as the primary inspiration for the [[tetsujin 28-gou (2004)|2004 anime series]].

This iteration of Tetsujin was aired in America under the localized title [b]Gigantor[/b], which dubbed 52 of the original 97 episodes.
other_names: 鉄人28号(テレビアニメ第1作)

title: shogun_warriors
body:
Shogun Warriors was a short-lived [[Marvel]] comic series featuring licensed Japanese [[super robot]]s as part of the Marvel superhero universe. The comic series focused on three robots in particular - [[Raideen (mecha)|]] (renamed Raydeen), [[Combattler V (robot)|]] (renamed Combattra), and [[Danguard Ace]] (renamed Dangard Ace). The three robots were piloted by new original characters and the combiners were changed from multi-pilot units to single-pilot.

The comic series was an extension of Mattel's late 70s/early 80s toyline of the same name, which featured imported Japanese [[mecha]] toys from assorted anime  and [[tokusatsu]] series, as well as some [[kaiju]]. Apart from the robots listed above and some [[Super Sentai]] toys, the following were featured exclusively in the toyline.

* [[One-Seven]] from [[Daitetsujin 17]] (renamed to 17 Robot)
* [[Daimos]] from [[Toushou Daimos]] (renamed to Dynamo, as in the Starbirds dub)
* [[Getter Dragon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Dragun, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Getter Liger]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Raiden)
* [[Getter Poseidon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Poseidon, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Gaiking (dmg)|]] from [[Gaiking]]
* [[Grendizer]] from [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] (someties called Grandizer)
* [[Great Mazinger (robot)|]] from [[Great Mazinger]] (sometimes called Great Mazinger or simply Mazinga)
* [[Leopardon]] from [[Spider-Man (toei)|]] (with no references to Spider-Man himself made on the product)
* [[Voltes V (mecha)|]] from [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]]
* [[Getter-1]] from [[Getter Robo (classic)|]] (sold as a [[model kit]] only)
* [[Godzilla]]
* [[Rodan]]

title: cookie_(touhou)
body:
[b]Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss[/b], or [b]Cookie☆[/b] for short, is a [[Touhou]] voice drama that was uploaded on Valentine's Day 2010 featuring eight amateur voice actresses and over twenty artists.

The video received heavy criticism for being very boring and voiced by actresses who didn't really know Touhou, before receiving more hate after news broke of what Cookie☆'s creator [[Hazuna Rio]] did. The video's tags were vandalized and it attracted the [[Manatsu no Yo no Inmu]] fanbase who actually appreciated the cheesy storytelling and bad voice acting, resulting in Cookie☆ becoming a spin-off or even separate entity from Touhou. The drama resulted in the both accidental and intentional doxxing of all of the voice actresses and the creator.

A few months later, three other voice dramas popularly known together as "Cookie☆☆" were organized by [[Taisa (Cookie)|Taisa]] and picked up by Cookie☆ fans who remade these videos in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], with these voice actresses also getting doxxed. As Cookie☆'s popularity grew, many more voice dramas were made but this wiki only includes ones noteworthy enough to get fan art. 

Due to connections with the Inmu fanbase, fans typically refer to a character by an initialism of their name (e.g. Reu -> RU, Uzuki -> UDK, etc.) with either "Aniki" (兄貴, lit. "Big Brother") or "Aneki" (姉貴, lit. "Big Sister") attached to them at the end,  corresponding to the voice actor's gender. This is called "[[Tadano Kazuhito|TDN]] Notation" (TDN表記).

h4.Characters

h6. Original Cast ("Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHIYAaJ7CKg]) by [[Hazuna Rio]]

* [[Reu (cookie)|]] as [[Hakurei Reimu]] (see also: [[Sakenomi (cookie)|]], [[Reu Daikon]] and [[Ru (cookie)|]])
* [[Uzuki (Cookie)|Uzuki Kousei]] as [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[hinase (cookie)|Hinase Haruka]] as [[Alice Margatroid]] and [[Daiyousei]] ([[DIYUSI (cookie)|]]) (see also: [[Hinase Haruka]], [[SIYUDI (cookie)|]], and [[Chiibou (cookie)|]])
* [[Yamin (Cookie)|]] as [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Cirno]], and [[Patchouli Knowledge]]
* [[Genpatsu (cookie)|]] as [[Izayoi Sakuya]] (see also: [[Tsurikichi Obasan]])
* [[Nadeko (Cookie)|]] as [[Rumia]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]] (and as artist)
* [[Macota (Cookie)|]] as [[Kazami Yuuka]], [[Hong Meiling]], and [[Remilia Scarlet]] 
* [[Yuzuyu (Cookie)|]] as [[Koakuma]] and [[Mystia Lorelei]] 
* [[INU (Cookie)|]] as [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* [[TORI (cookie)|]] as [[Shameimaru Aya]]
* [[Garbage (cookie)|]] as [[Medicine Melancholy]] 
* [[Cirno (cookie)|]] on Reimu's tea container and background character
* [[Shishou (cookie)|]] as [[Onozuka Komachi]]
* [[The Chicken that Appears in the Middle of Cookie]]

Fans usually just call Alice "ALC", Rumia "RMA", and Suika "SIK" thanks to the TDN Notation.

h6. Monorail☆ ("I made a Touhou Anime":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r2FfP2a-iPk] by [[Kasuya (peach heaven)]]

title: i-503_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine [i]I-503[/i], the ex-Italian [[Comandante Cappellini (kancolle)|]]. 

Her Japanese uniform changes to a [[white one-piece swimsuit]] while her [[hair bow]] holding her [[twintails]] changes color to [[red bow|red]]. She also discards her thigh boots for a barefoot appearance.
